   19: %%
   20: -module(shell_docs_SUITE).
   21: -export([all/0, suite/0, groups/0, init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   22:    init_per_group/2, end_per_group/2]).
   23: 
   24: -export([render/1, render_smoke/1, links/1, normalize/1, render_prop/1,
   25:          render_non_native/1]).
   26: 
   27: -export([render_all/1, update_render/0, update_render/1]).
   28: 
   29: -include_lib("kernel/include/eep48.hrl").
   30: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   31: 
   32: suite() ->
   33:     [{timetrap,{minutes,20}}].
   34: 
   35: all() ->
   36:     [render_smoke, render, render_non_native, links, normalize, {group, prop}].
   37: 
   38: groups() ->
   39:     [{prop,[],[render_prop]}].
   40: 
   41: %% Include a spec here in order to test that specs of undocumented functions
   42: %% is rendered correctly.
   43: -spec init_per_suite(Config1) -> Config2 when
   44:       Config1 :: list({atom(),term()}),
   45:       Config2 :: list({atom(),term()}).
   46: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   47:     {ok, ?MODULE} = c:c(?MODULE,[debug_info]),
   48:     Config.
   49: 
   50: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   51:     ok.
   52: 
   53: init_per_group(prop, Config) ->
   54:     ct_property_test:init_per_suite(Config);
   55: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   56:     Config.
   57: 
   58: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   59:     Config.
   60: 
   61: %% We keep the docs of a couple of complex modules
   62: %% in the data_dir in order to compare then with the original
   63: %% when we fix bugs so that we don't break anything.
   64: %%
   65: %% This testcase is always run so that we do now forget to
   66: %% check that any bugfix does not break the current behaviour.
   67: %%
   68: %% If you do a bugfix that does not break this testcase when
   69: %% fixed you should include that module in the list of modules
   70: %% tested.
   71: %%
   72: %% Currently the modules are:
   73: -define(RENDER_MODULES, [sofs, re, file, erlang, user_drv, ?MODULE]).
   74: %% If you need to update the definition because this
   75: %% testcase fails, just run update_render/0,1.
   76: render(Config) ->
   77: 
   78:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
   79: 
   80:     lists:foreach(
   81:       fun(Module) ->
   82:               {ok, [D]} = file:consult(filename:join(DataDir, atom_to_list(Module) ++ ".docs_v1")),
   83:               maps:map(
   84:                 fun(FName, Current) ->
   85:                         case file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir,FName)) of
   86:                             {ok, Original} when Original =:= Current ->
   87:                                 ok;
   88:                             {ok, Original} ->
   89:                                 ct:log("Original: ~n~ts",[Original]),
   90:                                 ct:log("Current : ~n~ts",[Current]),
   91:                                 ct:fail(output_changed);
   92:                             {error, enoent} ->
   93:                                 %% All modules are not available on all
   94:                                 %% platforms. For instance socket is not
   95:                                 %% available on windows.
   96:                                 ok
   97:                         end
   98:                 end, render_module(Module, D))
   99:       end, ?RENDER_MODULES).
  100: 
  101: update_render() ->
  102:     update_render(
  103:       filename:join([os:getenv("ERL_TOP"),
  104:                      "lib", "stdlib", "test", "shell_docs_SUITE_data"])).
  105: update_render(DataDir) ->
  106:     lists:foreach(
  107:       fun(Module) ->
  108:               case code:get_doc(Module) of
  109:                   {ok, D} ->
  110:                       ok = file:write_file(
  111:                              filename:join(DataDir, atom_to_list(Module) ++ ".docs_v1"),
  112:                              io_lib:format("~w.",[D])),
  113:                       maps:map(
  114:                         fun(FName, Output) ->
  115:                                 ok = file:write_file(filename:join(DataDir, FName), Output)
  116:                         end, render_module(Module, D));
  117:                   E ->
  118:                       io:format("Error processing: ~p ~p",[Module, E])
  119:               end
  120:       end, ?RENDER_MODULES).
  121: 
  122: render_smoke(_Config) ->
  123:     docsmap(
  124:       fun(Mod, #docs_v1{ docs = Docs } = D) ->
  125:               lists:foreach(
  126:                 fun(Config) ->
  127:                         try
  128:                             E = fun({error,_}) ->
  129:                                         ok;
  130:                                    (Doc) ->
  131:                                         unicode:characters_to_binary(Doc)
  132:                                 end,
  133:                             E(shell_docs:render(Mod, D, Config)),
  134:                             E(shell_docs:render_type(Mod, D, Config)),
  135:                             E(shell_docs:render_callback(Mod, D, Config)),
  136: 
  137:                             Exports = try Mod:module_info(exports)
  138:                                       catch _:undef -> []
  139:                                       end, %% nif file not available on this platform
  140: 
  141:                             DHTML = markdown_to_shelldoc(D),
  142:                             [try
  143:                                  E(shell_docs:render(Mod, F, A, DHTML, Config))
  144:                              catch _E:R:ST ->
  145:                                      io:format("Failed to render ~p:~p/~p~n~p:~p~n~p~n",
  146:                                                [Mod,F,A,R,ST,shell_docs:get_doc(Mod,F,A)]),
  147:                                      erlang:raise(error,R,ST)
  148:                              end || {F,A} <- Exports],
  149: 
  150:                             [try
  151:                                  E(shell_docs:render_type(Mod, T, A, DHTML, Config))
  152:                              catch _E:R:ST ->
  153:                                      io:format("Failed to render type ~p:~p/~p~n~p:~p~n~p~n",
  154:                                                [Mod,T,A,R,ST,shell_docs:get_type_doc(Mod,T,A)]),
  155:                                      erlang:raise(error,R,ST)
  156:                              end || {{type,T,A},_,_,_,_} <- Docs],
  157: 
  158:                             [try
  159:                                  E(shell_docs:render_callback(Mod, T, A, DHTML, Config))
  160:                              catch _E:R:ST ->
  161:                                      io:format("Failed to render callback ~p:~p/~p~n~p:~p~n~p~n",
  162:                                                [Mod,T,A,R,ST,shell_docs:get_callback_doc(Mod,T,A)]),
  163:                                      erlang:raise(error,R,ST)
  164:                              end || {{callback,T,A},_,_,_,_} <- Docs]
  165:                         catch throw:R:ST ->
  166:                                 io:format("Failed to render ~p~n~p:~p~n",[Mod,R,ST]),
  167:                                 exit(R)
  168:                         end
  169:                 end, [#{},
  170:                       #{ ansi => false },
  171:                       #{ ansi => true },
  172:                       #{ columns => 5 },
  173:                       #{ columns => 150 },
  174:                       #{ encoding => unicode },
  175:                       #{ encoding => latin1 }])
  176:       end),
  177:     ok.
  178: 
  179: markdown_to_shelldoc(#docs_v1{format = Format}=Docs) ->
  180:     DefaultFormat = <<"text/markdown">>,
  181:     DFormat = binary_to_list(DefaultFormat),
  182:     case Format of
  183:         _ when Format =:= DefaultFormat orelse Format =:= DFormat ->
  184:             ModuleDoc = Docs#docs_v1.module_doc,
  185:             Doc = Docs#docs_v1.docs,
  186:             Docs#docs_v1{format = ?NATIVE_FORMAT,
  187:                          module_doc = process_moduledoc(ModuleDoc),
  188:                          docs = process_doc_attr(Doc)};
  189:         _  ->
  190:             Docs
  191:     end.
  192: 
  193: -spec process_moduledoc(Doc :: map() | none | hidden) -> map() | none | hidden.
  194: process_moduledoc(Doc) when Doc =:= none orelse Doc =:= hidden ->
  195:     Doc;
  196: process_moduledoc(Doc) when is_map(Doc) ->
  197:     maps:map(fun (_K, V) -> shell_docs_markdown:parse_md(V) end, Doc).
  198: 
  199: process_doc_attr(Doc) ->
  200:     lists:map(fun process_doc/1, Doc).
  201: 
  202: process_doc(Docs) when is_list(Docs) ->
  203:     lists:map(fun process_doc/1, Docs);
  204: process_doc({_At, _A, _S, Doc, _M}=Entry) when Doc =:= none orelse Doc =:= hidden ->
  205:     Entry;
  206: process_doc({Attributes, Anno, Signature, Doc, Metadata}) ->
  207:     Docs = maps:map(fun (_K, V) -> shell_docs_markdown:parse_md(V) end, Doc),
  208:     {Attributes, Anno, Signature, Docs, Metadata}.
  209: 
  210: 
  211: render_prop(Config) ->
  212: %    dbg:tracer(),dbg:p(all,c),dbg:tpl(shell_docs_prop,[]),
  213:     ct_property_test:quickcheck(
  214:       shell_docs_prop:prop_render(),Config).
  215: 
  216: links(_Config) ->
  217:     docsmap(
  218:       fun(Mod, #docs_v1{ module_doc = MDoc, docs = Docs, format = ?NATIVE_FORMAT }) ->
  219:               try
  220:                   [check_links(Mod, maps:get(<<"en">>,MDoc)) || MDoc =/= none, MDoc =/= hidden]
  221:               catch _E1:R1:ST1 ->
  222:                       io:format("Failed to render ~p~n~p:~p~n~p~n",
  223:                                 [Mod,R1,ST1,MDoc]),
  224:                       erlang:raise(error,R1,ST1)
  225:               end,
  226:               [try
  227:                   check_links(Mod, D)
  228:                catch _E:R:ST ->
  229:                        io:format("Failed to render ~p:~p~n~p:~p~n~p~n",
  230:                                  [Mod,Kind,R,ST,D]),
  231:                        erlang:raise(error,R,ST)
  232:                end || {Kind,_Anno,_Sig,#{ <<"en">> := D },_MD} <- Docs];
  233:          (Mod, #docs_v1{ format = Fmt }) ->
  234:               io:format("Skipping ~p because format is ~ts~n",
  235:                         [Mod, Fmt])
  236:       end).
  237: 
  238: check_links(Mod, [{a,Attr,C}|T]) ->
  239:     case proplists:get_value(rel,Attr) of
  240:         <<"https://erlang.org/doc/link/seemfa">> ->
  241:             case string:lexemes(proplists:get_value(href, Attr),":#/") of
  242:                 [_App,TargetMod,Func,Arity] ->
  243:                     case code:get_doc(b2a(TargetMod)) of
  244:                         {ok, _ModDoc} ->
  245:                             case shell_docs:get_doc(b2a(TargetMod),
  246:                                                     b2a(Func),
  247:                                                     binary_to_integer(Arity)) of
  248:                                 [] -> throw({could_not_find,b2a(TargetMod),
  249:                                                 b2a(Func),
  250:                                                 binary_to_integer(Arity)});
  251:                                 _Else  -> ok
  252:                             end;
  253:                         _Else ->
  254:                             throw({could_not_find, TargetMod, Attr})
  255:                     end;
  256:                 _Callback ->
  257:                     ok
  258:             end;
  259:         _OtherlinkType ->
  260:             ok
  261:     end,
  262:     check_links(Mod, C),
  263:     check_links(Mod, T);
  264: check_links(Mod, [{_,_,C}|T]) ->
  265:     check_links(Mod, C),
  266:     check_links(Mod, T);
  267: check_links(Mod, [C|T]) when is_binary(C) ->
  268:     check_links(Mod, T);
  269: check_links(_, []) ->
  270:     ok.
  271: 
  272: normalize(_Config) ->
  273:     ?assertMatch(
  274:        [{p,[],[{em,[],[<<"a ">>,{code,[],[<<"b ">>]},<<"c">>]}]}],
  275:        shell_docs:normalize([{p,[],[{em,[],[<<" a ">>,{code,[],[<<" b  ">>]},<<" c">>]}]}])
  276:       ),
  277:     ?assertMatch(
  278:        [{'div',[],[<<"!">>]}],
  279:        shell_docs:normalize([{'div',[],[{code,[],[<<" ">>,{i,[],[<<" ">>]}]},<<" !">>]}])
  280:       ),
  281:     ok.
  282: 
  283: %% Special binary_to_atom that deals with <<"'and'">>
  284: b2a(Bin) ->
  285:     case erl_scan:string(binary_to_list(Bin)) of
  286:         {ok,[{atom,_,A}],_} -> A;
  287:         {ok,[{A,_}],_} -> A
  288:     end.
  289: 
  290: %% Test rendering of non-native modules
  291: render_non_native(_Config) ->
  292:     Docs = #docs_v1{
  293:         anno = erl_anno:new(13),
  294:         beam_language = not_erlang,
  295:         format = <<"text/asciidoc">>,
  296:         module_doc = #{<<"en">> => <<"This is\n\npure text">>},
  297:         docs = []
  298:     },
  299: 
  300:     <<"\n\tnot_an_erlang_module\n\n"
  301:       "    This is\n"
  302:       "    \n"
  303:       "    pure text\n">> =
  304:         unicode:characters_to_binary(
  305:           shell_docs:render(not_an_erlang_module, Docs, #{ ansi => false })),
  306: 
  307:     ok.
  308: 
  309: %% Testing functions
  310: render_all(Dir) ->
  311:     file:make_dir(Dir),
  312:     %% We load all possible application in order to be able to use
  313:     %% application:get_application to get the application a module
  314:     %% belongs to.
  315:     PossibleApplications =
  316:         lists:flatmap(
  317:           fun(P) ->
  318:                   filelib:wildcard(filename:join(P, "*.app"))
  319:           end, code:get_path()),
  320:     [application:load(list_to_atom(filename:basename(filename:rootname(App)))) ||
  321:         App <- PossibleApplications],
  322:     docsmap(fun(Mod, D) ->
  323:                     maps:map(
  324:                       fun(FName, Value) ->
  325:                               file:write_file(filename:join(Dir, FName), Value)
  326:                       end, render_module(Mod, D))
  327:             end).
  328: 
  329: render_module(Mod, #docs_v1{ docs = Docs } = D) ->
  330:     Opts = #{ ansi => true, columns => 80, encoding => unicode },
  331:     case application:get_application(Mod) of
  332:         {ok, App} ->
  333:             App;
  334:         _ ->
  335:             App = unknown
  336:     end,
  337:     SMod = atom_to_list(App) ++ "_" ++ atom_to_list(Mod),
  338:     Files =
  339:         #{
  340:           SMod ++ ".txt" =>
  341:               unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render(Mod, D, Opts)),
  342:           SMod ++ "_type.txt" =>
  343:               unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render_type(Mod, D, Opts)),
  344:           SMod ++ "_cb.txt" =>
  345:                     unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render_callback(Mod, D, Opts))
  346:          },
  347:     lists:foldl(
  348:       fun({_Type,_Anno,_Sig,none,_Meta}, Acc) ->
  349:               Acc;
  350:          ({{function,Name,Arity},_Anno,_Sig,_Doc,_Meta}, Acc) ->
  351:               FAName = SMod ++ "_"++atom_to_list(Name)++"_"++integer_to_list(Arity)++"_func.txt",
  352:               FName = SMod ++ "_"++atom_to_list(Name)++"_func.txt",
  353:               FADocs = unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render(Mod, Name, Arity, D, Opts)),
  354:               FDocs = unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render(Mod, Name, D, Opts)),
  355:               case string:equal(FADocs,FDocs) of
  356:                   true -> 
  357:                       Acc#{ sanitize(FAName) => FADocs };
  358:                   false ->
  359:                       Acc#{ sanitize(FAName) => FADocs,
  360:                             sanitize(FName) => FDocs}
  361:               end;
  362:          ({{type,Name,Arity},_Anno,_Sig,_Doc,_Meta}, Acc) ->
  363:               FName = SMod ++ "_"++atom_to_list(Name)++"_"++integer_to_list(Arity)++"_type.txt",
  364:               Acc#{ sanitize(FName) =>
  365:                         unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render_type(Mod, Name, Arity, D, Opts))};
  366:          ({{callback,Name,Arity},_Anno,_Sig,_Doc,_Meta}, Acc) ->
  367:               FName = SMod ++ "_"++atom_to_list(Name)++"_"++integer_to_list(Arity)++"_cb.txt",
  368:               Acc#{ sanitize(FName) =>
  369:                         unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render_callback(Mod, Name, Arity, D, Opts))}
  370:       end, Files, Docs).
  371: 
  372: sanitize(FName) ->
  373:     lists:foldl(
  374:       fun({Re,Replace}, Txt) ->
  375:               re:replace(Txt,Re,Replace,[global,{return,list}])
  376:       end, FName, [{"/","slash"},{":","colon"},
  377:                    {"\\*","star"},{"<","lt"},{">","gt"},{"=","eq"}]).
  378: 
  379: docsmap(Fun) ->
  380:     lists:map(
  381:       fun F({Mod,_,_}) ->
  382:               F(Mod);
  383:           F(Mod) when is_list(Mod) ->
  384:               F(list_to_atom(Mod));
  385:           F(Mod) ->
  386:               case code:get_doc(Mod) of
  387:                   {error, missing} ->
  388:                       ok;
  389:                   {error, cover_compiled} ->
  390:                       ok;
  391:                   {error, E} when E =:= eperm; E =:= eacces; E =:= eio ->
  392:                       %% This can happen in BSD's for some reason...
  393:                       ok;
  394:                   {error, eisdir} ->
  395:                       %% Uhm?
  396:                       ok;
  397:                   {ok, Docs} ->
  398:                       try
  399:                           Fun(Mod, Docs)
  400:                       catch E:R:ST ->
  401:                               io:format("Failed to render ~p~n~p:~p:~p~n",[Mod,E,R,ST]),
  402:                               erlang:raise(E,R,ST)
  403:                       end
  404:               end
  405:       end, code:all_available()).
